title: Evening showers expected in several areas in next few days
byline: Atmospheric conditions are getting favorable for evening thundershowers in the Northern, North-Central, Central, Uva and Eastern provinces during the next few days, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Deshabandu Tennakoon to be produced before court today
byline: Former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), is scheduled to be produced before the Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today (21).

title: Israeli military says first stages of assault on Gaza City have begun
byline: The Israeli military says it has begun the “preliminary actions” of a planned ground offensive to capture and occupy all of Gaza City and already has a hold on its outskirts.

title: Parliamentary Business Committee to discuss no-confidence motion today
byline: A meeting of the Committee on Parliamentary Business is scheduled to be held in Parliament today (21) at 12 noon, chaired the Speaker of the House, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Supplementary medical professionals launch strike across 31 hospitals under WPC
byline: The Joint Council of Professions Supplementary to Medicine (JCPSM) announced that an indefinite strike has been launched today (21) across 31 hospitals under the Western Provincial Council, in protest against the implementation of the 2024 transfer orders, which they claim were issued amid serious irregularities and strong opposition.

title: Arrest warrant issued for Diana Gamage
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has issued a warrant for the arrest of former State Minister Diana Gamage, who faces charges under the Immigration and Emigration Act.

title: Chinese scientists battling to save finless porpoise from brink of extinction
byline: Chinese scientists are in a battle to save one of the last large animal species living in the Yangtze River – and a complete ban on fishing in the region is helping them.

title: One in five people in Western Province suffer from diabetes, health experts warn
byline: One in every five people in Western Province has diabetes as a consequence of excessive sugar consumption, according to health experts.

title: Detention orders on suspected gunman in ex-Homagama PS member’s murder
byline: Police have obtained detention orders to question the gunman allegedly involved in the shooting and killing of former Homagama Pradeshiya Sabha member Shantha Mudunkotuwa.

title: CoPF approves Budget Estimate of National Audit Office
byline: The Budget Estimate of the National Audit Office for the year 2026 was taken up for consideration at the Committee on Public Finance(CoPF) held on Tuesday (19) and was approved to be presented to Parliament with the Committee’s proposals, the Department of Communication of Parliament said.

title: Indictments served on ex-Minister Anura Yapa and five others
byline: Former Minister Anura Priyadharshana Yapa and five others have been served indictments by the Attorney General today (21) before the Colombo High Court.

title: Sony raises PlayStation 5 prices in US as tariff fears persist
byline: Sony PlayStation 5 gaming consoles in the US will jump by around $50 (£37.16) from Thursday as the Japanese technology giant grapples with rising costs and a slowing video game market.

title: Special notice for motorists: Road section sinking in Borella
byline: A section of the road from Model Farm Road Junction towards D.S. Senanayake Junction in Borella has been reported sinking.

title: Two youths missing after drowning in separate incidents
byline: A 27-year-old youth from Bibila area has reportedly gone missing after drowning while bathing in the Bowathenna Reservoir in the Naula police division.

title: Frank Caprio: ‘Nicest judge in the world’ dies after cancer diagnosis
byline: A US judge who amassed a huge online fan base via clips of his compassion in the courtroom has died.

title: UN chief urges immediate Gaza ceasefire, warns of casualties from Israeli operation
byline: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Thursday called for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, after Israel announced the first steps of an operation to take over Gaza City.

title: Govt. to launch ‘Seiri Week’ for disposing of unnecessary items accumulated in state institutions
byline: The government has taken steps to implement a special program to dispose unnecessary items which have accumulated in all state institutions.

title: India mulls easing visa restrictions for Chinese business executives after five-year freeze
byline: India is likely to relax restrictions on business visas for Chinese professionals, a move aimed at reviving corporate ties and smoothing operations for multinational companies after nearly five years of curbs, government and industry, according to a report.

title: Officials post court notice at ex-Minister Rajitha’s residence
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who is currently absconding authorities despite an order issued by court, has had official notices posted at his residence in Malabe today (21) by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: List of top 50 US colleges for career success in 2025
byline: LinkedIn has announced a list of top 50 US colleges that students should seek to enroll to ensure success in 2025. The right institution deepens subject-specific knowledge, offers hands-on experience, nurtures potential, and equips students to take on demanding roles in the future.

title: Warm weather advisory issued for several provinces
byline: A warm weather advisory has been issued for residents of the Northern, North-central and Eastern provinces and in Hambantota and Monaragala districts.

title: Three more petitions filed challenging bill to revoke privileges of former Presidents
byline: Three more petitions have been filed before the Supreme Court challenging the clauses of the bill presented in Parliament by the government to revoke the privileges of former Presidents, on the grounds that it is contrary to the Constitution.

title: Ex-IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon remanded
byline: Former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department, yesterday, has been remanded until August 27.

title: Presidential Investigation Committee on irregularities at SriLankan Airlines & AASL invites public complaints, views and proposals
byline: The Presidential Special Investigation Committee, established to probe into past fraud, corruption and malpractices at Airport and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited and SriLankan Airlines, has invited complaints, views, and proposals from the public.

title: Three-wheeler driver sentenced to death for killing man in Kelaniya
byline: A 43-year-old three-wheeler driver has been sentenced to death by the Colombo High Court today, after being found guilty of stabbing and killing a person with a sharp weapon following an argument.

title: President meets Cardinal Ranjith and Catholic Bishops
byline: A meeting was held on Wednesday (August 20) at the Presidential Secretariat between His Eminence Archbishop of Colombo, Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith, the members of the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of Sri Lanka (CBCSL) and President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Google’s Pixel 10 phones raises the ante on artificial intelligence
byline: Google on Wednesday unveiled a new line-up of Pixel smartphones injected with another dose of artificial intelligence that’s designed to do everything from fetch vital information stored on the devices to help improve photos as they’re being taken.

title: President’s Fund to expand assistance programmes for persons with disabilities
byline: A meeting has been held in a bid to expand the services provided through the President’s Fund for persons with disabilities, as well as the execution of programmes in partnership with the National Secretariat for Persons with Disabilities.

title: Applications called to fill vacancy in Police Commission
byline: Applications have been called from qualified individuals to fill a vacancy in the National Police Commission.

title: Postal Strike: Stand-off between unions and authorities continues
byline: Postal unions are not prepared to call off their ongoing strike to engage in discussions with authorities, Chinthaka Bandara, the co- convener of the United Postal Trade Unions’ Front stated.

title: Man nabbed while transporting Rs. 20 million worth of heroin inside plumbing pipe
byline: An individual has been arrested in Payagala while transporting a stock of heroin concealed inside a plumbing pipe, police stated.

title: Staff shortages threaten flight safety in India - report
byline: India’s aviation safety regulator is grappling with a staffing crisis that is severely affecting its ability to fulfil its mandate, a parliamentary panel has warned in a new report.

title: China-Sri Lanka working to promote high-quality BR cooperation – Chinese envoy
byline: China and Sri Lanka are currently working hand in hand to promote high-quality Belt and Road cooperation, Sri Lanka’s Chinese Ambassador Qi Zhenhong said.

title: Russia launches biggest wave of strikes on Ukraine for weeks
byline: Russia has launched 574 drones and 40 missiles on Ukraine in one of the heaviest bombardments in weeks, Ukrainian officials say.

title: Man shot dead near Thun Bodhiya bridge in Bandaragama
byline: An individual has been shot dead near the Thun Bodhiya Bridge in Bandaragama, a short while ago, police stated.

title: Actor Vijay to contest 2026 Tamil Nadu election from Madurai East
byline: Actor-politician Vijay says he will contest next year’s Tamil Nadu elections from the Madurai East constituency.

title: All train services between Maradana and Colombo Fort delayed
byline: All train services between Maradana and Colombo Fort stations have been disrupted due to a stalled train near the Dematagoda yard.

title: PM wants schools sports culture to prioritize physical and mental well-being of students
byline: A discussion has been held to deliberate proposals to promote school sports and resolving existing issues with the Ministries of Education and Sports.

title: All train between Maradana and Colombo Fort delayed
byline: Train services between Maradana and Colombo Fort Railway stations have been disrupted due to a ‘stalled train’ near the Dematagoda yard, the Railway Control Room said.

title: Excavations at Chemmani mass grave to continue for eight more weeks
byline: Excavations at the Chemmani Sindhubathi cemetery in Jaffna are likely to continue for eight more weeks, officials have said.

title: Ministry introduces affordable crop insurance scheme for farmers
byline: The Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Lands, and Irrigation has introduced a concessionary insurance scheme for key field crops, in a move to strengthen agricultural risk management.
